H0.text: Carbon dioxide is the substance that animals release and that plants take in, enabling plants to survive while animals obtain energy from eating food that comes from plants.

H1.text: Oxygen is the substance that animals release and that plants take in to survive, as animals obtain energy by eating food that comes from plants.

H2.text: Salt is the substance that animals release, which plants take in, as part of the cycle where animals get energy from eating food that comes from plants and plants survive by taking in substances released by animals.

H3.text: Sugar is the substance that animals release, which plants take in to survive.

A4.text: CO2 is released as waste by all aerobic organisms when they metabolize organic compounds to produce energy by respiration.

A5.text: oxygen is consumed by all aerobic organisms when they metabolize organic compounds to produce energy by respiration.
